channel.title: Better Daily
channel.description: Currated Content To Fine Tune Your Life

item.title: Backpacks: Products of Crowd Sourcing
item.description:
Why start my first post on backpacks?

I think there are a few items that make life better everyday. Having a great pack comes first because we need something to hold everything. I love having a pack that I can just grab and go and know I can handle anything throught my day.

In general, I am very careful with my money, but I rationalize spending more for things that really matter and would rather have less things but my thngs be better quality. The things I will be using everyday are worth higher quality beause spreading out the cost/usage, spending more just makes sense.

Factors

Criteria:

  1. Style
  2. Easily handle water bottles
  3. Lots of pockets and organization
  4. Minimal effort to access what you need
  5. Unique
  6. High quality materials

Different Uses:

  • Everyday bag, more general
  • Photography
  • Travel

Past Bags

I started out with finding Timbuk2 in high school. I first tried the basic messenger and then another random bag from them that was on sale.

  • add picture

Then I tried the Osprey Pixel. This bag met a lot of my expectations, such as pockets and organization, but contained the following flaws:

  • No outside water bottle pocket, this is a huge red flag because carrying around a water bottle on the inside of a bag takes up a lot of space and can spill, not to mention it is hard to access.
  • Side access laptop access, if you forget to close this, the laptop falls right out. I dented my MacBook air because of this

I now have ordered the Everyday BackPack from Indiegogo 30L because I definitely wasn’t satisfied with the Pixel.

The Options

I want to just jot down a bunch of the bags I have considered and thought cool. From there I will identify more prominent bags that stick out among bags that are already good.

I think it is best to get volume so that if nothing I pick is quite the best, you still have many more options to explore

The Gathering Phase:

  • The Joey surprised me with lots of features at not a bad price, Joey, $price

  • Teck packs are definitely catching on, this does not dissapoint in expectations LifePack, $Price

  • Cool Camera Bag prvke-21, $Price

  • A nice looking messenger, comparable to Timbuk2 7ven, $Price

  • Roll up, kinda innovating bag Henty Copilot, $Price

  • Zero Gravity, $Price

  • super slim and function, they also make some of my favorite wallets Slim Pack, $Price

  • Nice carry on Arcido, $Price

  • Pretty rugged adventure bag that is also feature richStandard Pacific, $Price

  • Another tech focused bag, Barracude, $Price

  • One I just ordered, looks awesome, Everyday Backpack, $Price

  • Really cool travel bag Nomatic, $Price

  • Just a cool bag company, Aersf, $Price

  • A really cool bag with some unique features Code10, $Price

Now add some pictures for the cooler bags

item.title: Welcome to Gravity!
item.description:
Gravity is an unopinionated theme for Jekyll, the awesome static site generator.

Some General Instructions for Jekyll

You’ll find this post in your _posts directory. Go ahead and edit it and re-build the site to see your changes. You can rebuild the site in many different ways, but the most common way is to run jekyll serve, which launches a web server and auto-regenerates your site when a file is updated.

To add new posts, simply add a file in the _posts directory that follows the convention YYYY-MM-DD-name-of-post.ext and includes the necessary front matter. Take a look at the source for this post to get an idea about how it works.

Jekyll also offers powerful support for code snippets:

Check out the Jekyll docs for more info on how to get the most out of Jekyll. File all bugs/feature requests at Jekyll’s GitHub repo. If you have questions, you can ask them on Jekyll Talk.
